ngiemboon: Pilato leen ńké ńnáa Yěsô ngie mé lɔg ngwɔɔn ńcúɔ yé.
en: Then Pilate took Jesus and had him flogged.

ngiemboon: Palÿɔ́ʼncù lɔg menzóŋ ḿbáʼa cÿɔ̀ʼɔ lefùɔ, éshuu twó Yěsô, ḿbíi pepàŋ nzsǒ ḿmaʼa na yé.
en: The soldiers also twisted together a crown   of thorns, put it on his head, and clothed him in a purple robe.

ngiemboon: Ńne sẅɛʼte nnɛ́ ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ yé, ésíe yé ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mé tsyɛʼté fùɔ pà Yúndà!» Ńne ńtéme mbwó metuŋó yé.
en: And they kept coming up to him   and saying, “Hail, king of the Jews! ” and were slapping his face.

ngiemboon: Pilato gíŋ ńkẅɛɛ pǐ ńgɔɔn né mekěm pà Yúndà ngie: «N ge lɔgɔ nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ tó ná né pi. Pi ké ńzsé ngie n kaa gyá tsɔ́ mmó gie à fʉ̌a wɔ́.»
en: Pilate went outside again and said to them, “Look, I’m bringing him out to you to let you know I find no grounds   for charging him.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgwaa kẅɛ, ńtɔʼɔ cÿɔ̀ʼɔ menzóŋ, ḿmaʼa paŋ nzsǒ. Pilato gɔɔn né mekěm pà Yúndà ngie: «Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ wɛ̂.»
en: Then Jesus came out wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe.   Pilate said to them, “Here is the man! ”  # 19:5 Zch 6:12

ngiemboon: Tá metándá panuŋepwɔʼ lâ papyɛ́bɛ jʉʼʉ ssé gyá Yěsô, ńzye lénáa gwá ńgɔɔn ngie: «Kime yé na tÿǒnkǐ! Kime yé na tÿǒnkǐ!» Pilato gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi kɔ yé, kwàʼ pi zɔ kime yé na tÿǒnkǐ. Mèŋ te ne ńgyá mmó gie mé ge cʉa mǒ, tá zẅé yé wɔ́.»
en: When the chief priests and the temple servants   saw him, they shouted, “Crucify! Crucify! ”

ngiemboon: Mekěm tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Mé ge zẅé yé, ńtí páʼ à gɔ̌ɔn ngie aa Míŋ Ssé, ńdɔgɔ púʼu é fʉa lepʉ̌ ség sie peg gẅiin.»
en: “We have a law,” the Jews replied to him, “and according to that law he ought to die,   because he made himself the Son of God.”  # 19:7 Jn 5:18; 19:12; Heb 1:2

ngiemboon: Pilato gwɔ́ tà ńjúʼ púʼu, éfó mege ńcÿɔʼ.
en: When Pilate heard this statement, he was more afraid than ever.

ngiemboon: Ḿbiŋe ndá, ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: «Ɔɔ nyìŋ nzɔ̌?» Táʼ, Yěsô fó te tsɔ́b.
en: He went back into the headquarters   and asked Jesus, “Where are you from? ” But Jesus did not give him an answer.  # 19:9 Mk 14:61

ngiemboon: Pilato leen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «N gɔɔn nò ɔ̀ těen ńtsɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́ lá? Ɔ̀ te ne ńzsé ngie n kuʼu légÿo mé nyé gú, páʼ n gíŋ ńkuʼu légÿo, mé kime gú na tÿǒnkǐ wɔ́ ka?»
en: So Pilate said to him, “Do you refuse to speak to me? Don’t you know that I have the authority to release you and the authority to crucify you? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «E Ssé lɔɔn ńnyé té ná metʉ̀ mbwó gù, ɔ̀ le kuʼu légÿo tsɔ́ mmó na mèŋ wɔ́. Áa mmó gie á ka gÿo tá mefʉa nyìŋ gẅie à ka sẅiŋe wɔ́ɔn mbwó gù, á cʉa gù.»
en: “You would have no authority over me at all,” Jesus answered him, “if it hadn’t been given you from above. This is why the one who handed me over to you has the greater sin.”

ngiemboon: Pilato zye fʉʼó léfaʼ shÿó páʼ à ge nyé Yěsô. Táʼ, pà Yúndà zye lénáa gwá ngie: «Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńnyé yé, mbà ɔ̀ te shǔ Kásà pà Loma wɔ́. Wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ gẅie à gɔɔn ngie yé aa fùɔ, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngàŋmbù Kásà.»
en: From that moment Pilate kept trying   to release him. But the Jews shouted, “If you release this man, you are not Caesar’s friend. Anyone who makes himself a king opposes Caesar! ”

ngiemboon: Pilato júʼ púʼu, ńdɔgɔ Yěsô fó ndá ńkẅɛ, ńnéŋe na lʉŋe nzàʼntsaŋ, á jʉʼ gie mé la lɔg «metǒon ńnuŋe», mé tóŋo na shwóŋè Ébɛ̀ ngie Ngambata.
en: When Pilate heard these words, he brought Jesus outside. He sat down on the judge’s seat in a place called the Stone Pavement (but in Aramaic,   Gabbatha).

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ gie mé cwoŋte línɔ̀ɔn pásékà, ńgwɔ́ mmó tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ. Pilato gɔɔn né pà Yúndà ngie: «Afùɔ gẅi wɛ̂.»
en: It was the preparation day for the Passover, and it was about noon.   Then he told the Jews, “Here is your king! ”

ngiemboon: Pa Yúndà náa gwá ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mé zẅé yé! Mé zẅé yé! Gÿo mé kime yé na tÿǒnkǐ!» Pilato gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Mèŋ zɔ ge kime fùɔ gẅi na tÿǒnkǐ ka?» Metándá panuŋepwɔʼ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «É té ndàʼ Kásà wɔ́, mbà peg te tsɔ̌ fùɔ gẅiin.»
en: They shouted, “Take him away! Take him away! Crucify him! ”

ngiemboon: Pilato leen ńké ńnáa Yěsô né pɔ́b, páʼ mé ge gʉa kime yé na tÿǒnkǐ.
en: Then he handed him over to be crucified.

ngiemboon: Ńgwaa fó tÿǒsoŋ kẅɛ, kwàʼ yé zɔ̌ kaa tÿǒnkǐ yé, pâ pɔ̌ ne ńgee né tsɔ́ jʉʼ, gie mé tóŋo lê «kẅǐ twó.» Á gwɔ́ na shwóŋè Ébɛ̀, ńgwɔ́ Ngɔɔgótà.
en: Carrying   the cross by himself,  # 19:17 Lk 9:23; 23:26 he went out to what is called Place of the Skull, which in Aramaic is called Golgotha.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúu wó, ńkime yé na tÿǒnkǐ, ńgíŋ ńkim petsɔ́ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a na mɔ́b metÿǒnkǐ. Tàʼ gwɔ́ na gwoŋó pwó Yěsô yetʉ̀, wetsɔ̌ gwɔ́ na gwoŋó yekyɛ̀bɛ. Yěsô gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ.
en: There they crucified him and two others with him, one on either side, with Jesus in the middle.

ngiemboon: Pilato gÿo mé ŋweʼe mmó, ńkime na tÿǒnkǐ. Á gwɔ́ mǒ ńgwɔ́ ngie: «Yěsô nyìŋ Nǎzalɛd, fùɔ pà Yúndà.»
en: Pilate also had a sign made and put on the cross. It said: Jesus of Nazareth, the King of the Jews.

ngiemboon: Ajʉʼ gie mé la kime Yěsô wó, á laa ngʉ̀ŋe tÿǒsoŋo Yelúzálèm. Pa Yúndà tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne ńcʉa jʉʼó ńtóŋo mmó gie mé ŋweʼé. Á gwɔ́ na shwóŋè Ébɛ̀, ńgwɔ́ na shwóŋè pà Loma mbɔɔ na shwóŋè pà Ngelékiya.
en: Many of the Jews read this sign, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city,   and it was written in Aramaic, Latin, and Greek.

ngiemboon: Metándá panuŋepwɔʼ pà Yúndà leen ńké ńgʉa ńgyá Pilato ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Á té poŋo léŋweʼe ngie “fùɔ pà Yúndà” wɔ́, ŋweʼe pɔ́ ngie “à la gɔɔn ngie yé aa fùɔ pà Yúndà.”»
en: So the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “Don’t write, ‘The king of the Jews,’   but that he said, ‘I am the king of the Jews.’ ”

ngiemboon: Pilato tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Ammó gie n ŋweʼé, n ně ńdáʼ ńŋweʼe.»
en: Pilate replied, “What I have written, I have written.”

ngiemboon: Palÿɔ́ʼncù la kime Yěsô na tÿǒnkǐ tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, ḿbí menzsǒ mé, ńgabte nzsè lekùɔ. Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pí ye nzsè, tà é cʉ́ʼ nzsǒ ye yelÿò, é gie mé la te vfo vfo wɔ́. Mé la pú ḿbáʼ páʼ, éfó tÿǒ ńtyé ssé.
en: When the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took his clothes and divided them into four parts, a part for each soldier. They also took the tunic, which was seamless, woven in one piece from the top.

ngiemboon: Palÿɔ́ʼncù gɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: «Tà pege shʉa yɔɔn. Pege maʼa tyèente, nyìŋ gẅie à jÿǒ, pege náa mbwó yé.» Á lɔgɔ ḿbumte na nò gie mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ngie: «Pɔ́ ně ńgabte menzsǒ mɔ́ɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ḿmaʼa tyèente na nzsǒ yɔ̀ɔn yelÿò.» Yɔɔn áa mmó gie palÿɔ́ʼncù la gÿo.
en: So they said to one another, “Let’s not tear it, but cast lots for it, to see who gets it.” This happened that the Scripture   might be fulfilled  # 19:24 Mt 1:22 that says: They divided my clothes among themselves, and they cast lots for my clothing.   # 19:24 Ps 22:18,# 19:24 Ps 22:18 This is what the soldiers did.

ngiemboon: Má pà Yěsô pɔ́ mémá má we wemanzwě, ńgÿo Malîɛ nzwě Kelopásè, mbɔɔ Malîɛ we Magndala la tyé ngʉ̀ŋe tÿǒnkǐ Yěsô.
en: Standing   by the cross  # 19:25 Lk 23:26 of Jesus were his mother,  # 19:25 Mt 1:16 his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.  # 19:25 Mk 15:40

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá páʼ má we tyé lejʉ́ŋ ngàŋakwò we gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo yé tɛʼ, ńgɔɔn né má we ngie: «Má wɔ̀ɔn, míŋ gù wɛ̂.»
en: When Jesus saw his mother and the disciple he loved   standing there, he said to his mother, “Woman, here is your son.”

ngiemboon: Ńgíŋ ńgɔɔn mbwó ngàŋakwò we ŋwɛ́ ngie: «Má gù wɛ̂.» Á fó fʉ̀ʼ ayɛ̌, angàŋakwò we ŋwɛ́ lɔgɔ má pà Yěsô ńgʉa né mbʉ̀a yé.
en: Then he said to the disciple, “Here is your mother.” And from that hour the disciple took her into his home.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò la tɔ́g, Yěsô zsé fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ngie akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ kǔʼ, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Agág yɔ́ɔn ne shÿó, ńgɔɔn páʼɔɔn légwɔ́ gie ammó gie mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ge pumte.»
en: After   this, when Jesus knew that everything was now finished  # 19:28 Lk 12:50; 18:31; 22:37; Jn 19:30; Ac 13:29; Heb 10:14; 11:40 that the Scripture might be fulfilled, he said, “I’m thirsty.”   # 19:28 Ps 22:15; 69:21

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ lekʉŋ laa jʉʼó, mbà mé neŋé kikíi melùʼ tsoló. Mé tsaba kusáa tsoló, éshÿɔ́gɔ na twó ntúlésẅɛ̀, ńtsege ńnéŋe ncwò Yěsô.
en: A jar full of sour wine was sitting there; so they fixed a sponge full of sour wine on a hyssop branch   and held it up to his mouth.

ngiemboon: Á sẅíte ńgɔɔn ngie: «Akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ pumté, ńdeen ńké ńcʉ́ŋe twó yé, ńkwé.»
en: When Jesus had received the sour wine, he said, “It is finished.”    Then bowing his head, he gave up his spirit.  # 19:30 1Jn 5:8

ngiemboon: Mé laa lyɛʼó ńne ńcwoŋte lyɛʼɛ́ nzse pà Yúndà, á piŋ te poŋ ngie à gwɔ́ lyɛʼɛ́ nzse, mepfó pʉ̀a gwɔ́ na metÿǒnkǐ wɔ́, yɛ̌ ge zɔɔn gwɔ́ lyɛʼɛ́ nzse lÿò tɛʼ. Mekěm pà Yúndà gʉa ńgyá Pilato, ésẅíŋte yé ngie à gÿo mé pwɔʼte mekwò pʉ̀a pie ée na metÿǒnkǐ, pɔ́ kwéte, mé fó na metÿǒnkǐ ésẅíʼi wɔ́b.
en: Since it was the preparation day,   the Jews did not want the bodies  # 19:31 Lk 12:4 to remain on the cross  # 19:31 Lk 23:26 on the Sabbath  # 19:31 Mk 2:23 (for that Sabbath was a special  # 19:31 Lit great day). They requested that Pilate have the men’s legs broken and that their bodies be taken away.  # 19:31 Dt 21:22–23; Jos 8:29; 10:26–27

ngiemboon: Palÿɔ́ʼncù leen ńké ńtó ḿbwɔ́ʼte mekwò ndùŋmvfò, mbɔɔ me mbɔ́ɔntè nyìŋ gẅie mé pǔ ńkime wɔ́b lâ Yěsô.
en: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first man and of the other one who had been crucified with him.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu na Yěsô, ńgyá, mbà à ně ńdáʼ ńkwé. Pɔ́ té gíŋ ḿbwɔ́ʼte mekwò mé wɔ́.
en: When they came to Jesus, they did not break his legs since they saw that he was already dead.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, atsɔ̌ tàʼ na palÿɔ́ʼncù lɔg lekwoŋ, ésɔbɔ gwoŋó nnɛ́ Yěsô. Metse pɔ́ ntse gwóon ńkẅɛɛ jʉʼó.
en: But one of the soldiers pierced   his side  # 19:34 Jn 20:20 with a spear, and at once blood and water  # 19:34 1Jn 5:6–9 came out.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à shwóŋo gẅí, aa njÿòngyá na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á la cʉa. Á gwɔ́ kwàʼ páʼ á la cʉa púʼu. Kwàʼ yé lé twó yé ne ńnyɛte ńzsé ngie à gɔɔn nò nénʉ́, ńgɔɔn páʼɔɔn légwɔ́ gie pi gí ge záb ntʉ́m na yɔɔn nò.
en: He who saw this has testified   so that you also may believe. His testimony is true, and he knows he is telling the truth.  # 19:35 Jn 21:24

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò lɔ́ɔn ńcʉate páʼɔɔn páʼ mmó gie mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ge pumte. Mé la ŋweʼe ngie: «Mé la te pwɔʼɔ tsɔ́ kẅǐ mbùm yé wɔ́.»
en: For these things happened so that the Scripture would be fulfilled:   Not one of his bones will be broken.   # 19:36 Ex 12:46; Nm 9:12; Ps 34:20,# 19:36 Ex 12:46; Nm 9:12; Ps 34:20

ngiemboon: Mé la gíŋ ńŋweʼe ngie: «Pɔ́ ge láʼ ńne líe nyìŋ gẅie pɔ́ lɔ̌g lekwoŋ ésɔbɔ yé.»
en: Also, another Scripture says: They will look at the one they pierced.   ,# 19:37 Zch 12:10

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò la tɔ́g, Yesyɛ̂b, nyìŋ tÿǒsoŋo Alimatê á gʉa ńgyá Pilato, ésẅíŋte yé ngie à zẅíŋ, à sẅíʼi pfó Yěsô na tÿǒnkǐ. Yesyɛ̂b ŋwɛ́ laa tsɔ́ ngàŋakwò Yěsô, tá shú shǔ, ńne ḿbɔ́gɔ pà Yúndà. Pilato zẅíŋ, Yesyɛ̂b gʉa ésẅíʼi pfó Yěsô.
en: After   this, Joseph of Arimathea, who was a disciple of Jesus #— #but secretly because of his fear of the Jews #— #asked Pilate that he might remove Jesus’s body.  # 19:38 Lk 12:4; Jn 2:21 Pilate gave him permission; so he came and took his body away.

ngiemboon: Níkondem gẅie à lǎʼ tsɔ̌ letsẅɛ́ʼ, ńtó ńgʉa ńgyá Yěsô la, á tó yé, ńgẅiin tsɔ̌ ntí laméndɔ̀ɔn gie mé la cub metwó megǐ ńdɔg ńgwɔʼ, mɛ̌ megǐ gwɔ́ mîi pɔ́ aloɛ́sè. Á gwɔ́ mmó kílò móm ntá.
en: Nicodemus   (who had previously come to him at night) also came, bringing a mixture of about seventy-five pounds  # 19:39 Lit a hundred litrai; a Roman litrai = 12 ounces of myrrh and aloes.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ Yesyɛ̂b leen ńké ńkaa pfó Yěsô, ńne ńkemte laméndɔ̀ɔn mǒ, ńdɔgɔ shúm nzsǒ ńzémte, páʼ pà Yúndà lɔ́ɔn ńgwaa leʼe pfó nyìŋ, ńgÿo púʼu.
en: They took Jesus’s body   and wrapped it in linen cloths  # 19:40 Jn 20:5 with the fragrant spices, according to the burial  # 19:40 Mk 14:8 custom of the Jews.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ nkáʼ laa ngʉ̀ŋe jʉʼ gie mé la kime Yěsô na tÿǒnkǐ wó. Etsɔ́ lesyè sesẅé gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ nkáʼ awɛ̌, mbà mé laa zɔɔn ńnéŋe nyìŋ tsoló wɔ́.
en: There was a garden in the place where he was crucified. A new tomb was in the garden; no one had yet been placed in it.

ngiemboon: Mé la néŋe pfó Yěsô pɔ́ tsoló, ńtí nue mé laa lyɛʼó, njÿó ge lʉ́a à gwɔ́ línɔ̀ɔn pà Yúndà, mbɔɔ páʼ ngʉ̀a sɛ̌ lesyè la vɔ́g.
en: They placed Jesus there because of the Jewish day of preparation and since the tomb was nearby.
